alert.note: Alert for Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 4:50AM EST until February 19 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mettawee River At Granville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Widespread flooding of fields along the river. Water on Upper Turnpike Road and Gray Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:31 AM EST Friday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:31 AM EST Friday was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.0 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.0 feet on 01/12/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Mettawee River Granville Flood Stage: 7.0 Observed Stage at Fri 4 am: 7.2 Forecast: Fri 7 am 8.0 Fri 1 pm 7.8 Fri 7 pm 7.0 Sat 1 am 6.5 Sat 7 am 6.2 Sat 1 pm 5.9 Sat 7 pm 5.7 Sun 1 am 5.5 Sun 7 am 5.4 Sun 1 pm 5.3 Sun 7 pm 5.2 Mon 1 am 5.1 &&
